result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean P Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with: victim or family.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
No possession of any weapons.
Domestic Abuse/violence counseling.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing at 10-19-2015 10:30 am
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Sean P Kelley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states they are not ready to proceed to plea/sentencing today. Defense is requesting an adjournment. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  The defendant to have no violent contact with the children.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Sean P Kelley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Defense just received discovery and needs to review discovery with his client. Court will give another date for plea/sentencing. Bail addressed. Court orders condition of bail be modified to "No violent contact with the children". Cash bail remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Sean P Kelley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Defense has discovery but no offer. Defense now has an offer and addresses treatment.  Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  The defendant may have supervised visits with the children.  Visits are to be supervised by the defendant's mother Kim Kresse or the victim, who shall be present during the entire time of the visits.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Sean P Kelley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
